title: Sonoma Ridge House / Holder Parlette
description: Set lightly on the edge of a ridge in the Sonoma Hills, the Sonoma Ridge House is thoughtfully designed to harmonize with its natural surroundings. Situated high above the Sonoma Valley, the home embraces sweeping views while integrating seamlessly with the landscape. Created for a young San Francisco couple, the residence steps down the ridge line, weaving around oak trees and carefully following the land's natural contours. Designed by Holder Parlette, a firm known for its integration of architecture, landscape, and interiors, the Ridge House exemplifies a deep commitment to connecting the built and natural environment, capturing the beauty of its site.
author: Hadir Al Koshta

title: Capela / Angela Castilho Arquitetura e Interiores
description: Located on the site that once housed the old pony stable, the chapel was conceived as a space for introspection, retreat, and spiritual connection.The choice of location stemmed from a desire to give new meaning to that part of the property, making use of a pre-existing structure built among a bamboo grove — a natural element that became essential to the new architectural essence.
author: Pilar Caballero

title: A Maui Home Blends Modern Minimalism With Climate-Conscious Design
description: A compact home in Maui by Hawaii Off Grid blends modern minimalism with climate-conscious design, featuring a sculptural roof and timber construction.
author: Caroline Williamson

title: HOCH & CHHO Transform a Former Hotel Into a Bold Tourist Residence
description: A former hotel in Paris' Montmartre is reimagined into bold tourist rentals by HOCH & CHHO with a postmodern and pop-laced sensibility.
author: Caroline Williamson

title: From abandoned to dreamy: see inside this mexican home’s spectacular makeover
description: In the heart of Mérida’s historic center in Mexico, an abandoned structure has been quietly transformed into a serene retreat. Designed by Veinte Diezz Arquitectos, Vistalcielo is a 155 m² vacation home that reimagines the rhythm of indoor and outdoor living. Through a careful balance of preservation and modern intervention, the house invites light, air, and calm into every corner.
author: Erin

title: Vaulted Ceilings and Garden Views Make This Home a True Sanctuary
description: Tucked into a quiet corner of Elwood, Sanctuary House by Minett Studio Architecture & Design offers a seamless blend of heritage and contemporary design. With vaulted ceilings, framed garden views, and an indoor–outdoor flow that feels effortless, this family home is a celebration of simplicity, sunlight, and sanctuary. Every space is designed for calm, flexibility, and daily ease, creating a retreat-like feel in the middle of suburbia.
author: Erin
